parameters.prompt: reggae, rasta, one nation, one love, unity, Jah, Zion, roots rock, bass guitar, drums, off-beat skank, horn section, conscious, uplifting, Bob Marley style
parameters.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Gather ‘round my brothers, sisters of the land
Rasta heart is beating steady like a drum
Chain no longer hold us, freedom in our hand
Guided by the light of Zion’s morning sun

[chorus]
One love, one heart, one nation under Jah
Keep the fire burning bright, drive away the dark
From Kingston to the hills, hear the people call
One nation under Jah, we stand together tall

[verse 2]
Babylon may tremble when the people rise as one
Voices blend in harmony, a song of truth and peace
Every chant a healing prayer until the work is done
Till the walls of hate and fear at last will cease

[bridge]
Jah provide the strength we need, in every trial and storm
Roots run deep in every soul, keep the spirit warm
No weapon formed against us ever shall prevail
In the heartbeat of the drum, our victory we hail

[verse 3]
Children of the rainbow, gather ‘round and sing
Colours of the earth and sky, painted on our flag
Let the message ring aloud: love is everything
Every woman, child, and man, none shall ever lag

[outro / chorus reprise]
One love, one heart, one nation under Jah
Keep the fire burning bright, drive away the dark
In the rhythm of our souls, we’ll never fall
One nation under Jah—together we stand tall.
